column4: What media player do people find best for dealing with a large library of music (a la iTunes and RhythmBox)?
I kinda like Kaffiene, myself.
And amaroK for music.
DathDevilous must've been using Trillian for his IRC client.
Ah, that could do it.
I use Kaffeine, with the xine engine, for video. It can even re-broadcast the feed. I haven't played with that feature yet. Going to soon. :)
Well, if he's anything like me, he could have multiple computers as well. You should see my media-server box.
Oh, I don't doubt that.  My family has twice as many computers as people, and two of them dual-boot Ubuntu-Windows.
Heh. In my house, I have 7 towers, a laptop, a TabletPC, a Casiopeia PocketPC, a RAID tower, and 4 4U rackmounts. :)
6 laptops, 4 desktops.
My media-server, actually can record up to 4 TV shows at the same time, in perfect quality, and stream them over the network using live stream, or VOD. :)
Interesting...  Never gotten into that sort of thing, but it sounds cool.

Yeah. It's nice stuff. I don't even own a regular TV anymore. I have one HDTV, without a tuner, and it itself is hooked up through the LAN and is literally streamed directly to, instead of using a TV tuner. :)
There is too a rescue option on the install disk
Where? F1-F10 showed nothing.
Type rescue at the prompt
I did. It went through the normal installation startup.
I'm not sure exactly how it work, but it's there..should get you to a root prompt I think.

Their really is no special "rescue" mode. It starts up, does it's whole detecting hardware thing, laods up the network via dhcp, and asks what hostname to use. From there, you can use the tty2, but, still.
What are you hoping to see?
Something a LITTLE more useful than busybox's minimal utility set, for one.
I was trying to copy my hde# to hdg#, making a partition-modified copy of my Kubuntu installation, so I could prevent having to re-install from scratch.
but /dev on a currently running K/Ubuntu system is tmpfs mounted, so I had to use, ironically, Gentoo's boot disc to properly do the cp -a from hde to hdg's stuff.
I see.
